snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had made a signature initiative of building the country’s largest convention center and a casino at the Aqueduct racetrack.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces that his $4 billion plan to create the country's largest convention center and a casino in Queens has fallen apart; Cuomo cites breakdown in negotiations between the state and Malaysian gambling company Genting; revelation leaves uncertain the future of Cuomo's drive to bring casino gambling to New York City.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and DANNY HAKIM
byline.contributor: Charles V. Bagli and Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had made a signature initiative of building the country’s largest convention center and a casino at the Aqueduct racetrack.

headline.seo: Plan Collapses for Queens Convention Hall and Casino
headline.main: Cuomo’s $4 Billion Plan for Project in Queens Falls Apart
headline.print_headline: Proposal To Put Convention Hall In Queens Is Off
